results.title: Mother and child
results.creator_credit: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
Explores the changing relationship between mother and child from birth to school age. Considers two common family crises involving separation - when either mother or child goes to hospital and the arrival of a new baby. Narrated by Hugh David.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC-TV

results.title: Home and away (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
The most important event in the life of most five year olds is starting school. With this comes a widening of relationships to include teachers and friends. It is not always an easy step and some children are disturbed by it.

results.title: We see it like this (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children Growing Up”.
In any form of self expression there is a development which is related to intellectual growth, physical growth and experience. To explore this, the program looks at the way in which children of different ages express their ideas of friendship.

results.title: Power of speech [B/W]
results.creator_credit: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children Growing Up”.
Discusses the early development of speech in children. Part three of the series considers the development of speech through the use of words. This is partly innate and partly due to training. Includes the problem of the late talking child, and discusses how it can be managed, based on the current ideas of language development.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC

results.title: Comforting your fussy baby (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child Health Series -Revised”.
This short film shows how parents should respond to the needs of their baby, particularly one which cries a lot. Emphasises the importance of tender loving care, and play.

results.title: Children's emotions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Child development series”.
Correlated with the book “Child development” by Elizabeth B. Hurlock, Ph. D., this film discusses the major emotions of childhood; curiosity, fear, anger, jealousy and joy. Children’s emotions are intense, frequent, but of short duration, and result in a number of behaviour responses.

results.title: The Twelve months examination
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”
The child’s personality has developed to the point where he has begun to relate closely to members of the family and their friends. He realises that people and objects have separate existence apart from himself, and that they continue to exist when they are out of sight. The primitive motor reflexes have been replaced with definitive motor actions.
